Detailed Description

Compute the articular jacobian J which gives the world velocity of a point (given in body coordinates) attached to a body (called EndNode) relative to another body called StartNode.

Obvioulsy, the only non-zero blocks in the jacobian will correspond to joints in the kinematic chain between StartNode and EndNode.

Such a jacobian can be used to control the relative pose of a body with respect to another body.

The jacobian size is normally 6 x Robot:NBDOF, however this algorithm takes an optional "offset" argument, and the actual jacobian size is 6 x (Robot:NBDOF+offset) If offset is positive, the first "offset" columns won't be touched by the algorithm. If offset is negative, the algorithm will only compile if the first offset column are not written by the algorithm, that is, if the correspondig joints are not in the kinematic chain between StartNode and EndNode.

const typename Robot::confVector &  q,
const Vector3d &  e_p,
Jacobian &  J 
) [inline, static]

Compute the articular jacobian J.

Parameters:
qConfiguration vector: it is used to update all body spatial transforms if bcalc is equal to true.
e_pCoordinates of point in EndBody coordinates.
Return values:
JComputed jacobian of size 6 x(NBDOF+offset). The algorithm will only write to the non-zero blocks of the jacobian. User should presumably zero J before passing it to the algorithm for the first time.

References metapod::jac_point_relative< Robot, start_node_id, end_node_id, offset, call_bcalc >::ancestor_node_id.

Referenced by metapod::jac_point_robot< Robot, call_bcalc >::DftVisitor< AnyRobot, node_id >::discover(), and metapod::jac_point_chain< Robot, start_node_id, end_node_id, offset, includeFreeFlyer, call_bcalc >::run().
